sourceString: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020
targetString: Makadirio ya Awali ya Maambukizi ya Hali Teule Sugu Miongoni mwa Wagonjwa wa Ugonjwa wa Virusi vya Korona 2019 — Marekani, Tarehe 12 Februari –28 Machi 2020

sourceString: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) a pandemic.
targetString: Mnamo tarehe 11 2020, Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni lilitangaza Ugonjwa wa Virusi vya Korona 2019 (COVID-19) kuwa ni janga kubwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 26,494 deaths have been reported worldwide.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, jumla ya visa 571,678 vya COVID-19 na vifo 26,494 vimeripotiwa ulimwenguni kote.

sourceString: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe disease include older age and the presence of at least one of several underlying health conditions.
targetString: Ripoti kutoka China na Italia zinaonyesha kwamba vigezo vya hatari vya ugonjwa mbaya ni pamoja na umri mkubwa na kuwepo kwa angalau moja kati ya hali kadhaa sugu za kiafya.

sourceString: U.S. older adults, including those aged ≥65 years and particularly those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated outcomes; however, data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Watu wazima wazee nchini Marekani, wakiwemo wale walio na miaka ≥65 na hususan wale walio na umri wa ≥85, pia wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa ya kuwa na matokeo yanayohusiana na COVID-19; hata hivyo, data inayoeleza hali sugu za afya miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19 nchini Marekani bado haijaripotiwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, U.S. states and territories have reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, including 7,162 (5.8%) for whom data on underlying health conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections were reported.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, majimbo na himaya za Marekani zimeripoti visa 122,653 vya COVID-19 nchini Marekani kwa CDC, ikiwa ni pamoja na 7,162 (5.8%) ambao kwao kuliripotiwa data kuhusu hali sugu za afya na vigezo vingine vya hatari kwa matokeo mabaya kutokana na maambukizi ya pumu.

sourceString: Among these 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying health condition or risk factor, and 4,470 (62.4%) had none of these conditions reported.
targetString: Miongoni mwa visa hivi 7,162, wagonjwa 2,692 (37.6%) walikuwa na hali moja au zaidi sugu au kigezo cha hatari na 4,470 (62.4%) hawakuwa na hali hizi.

sourceString: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying health condition or risk factor was higher among those requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission (358 of 457, 78%) and those requiring hospitalization without ICU admission (732 of 1,037, 71%) than that among those who were not hospitalized (1,388 of 5,143, 27%).
targetString: Asilimia ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 waliokuwa na angalau hali moja sugu ya afya au kigezo cha hatari ilikuwa juu miongoni mwa wale waliohitaji kulazwa kwenye chumba cha kuhudumia wagonjwa mahututi ICU (358 kati ya 457, 78%) na wale waliohitaji kulazwa hospitalini lakini sio katika ICU kwa 9732 kati ya 1,037, 71%) kuliko miongoni mwa wale ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini (1,388 kati ya 5,143, 27%).

sourceString: The most commonly reported conditions were diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease.
targetString: Hali zilizoripotiwa zaidi zilikuwa kisukari, ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu na ugonjwa wa matatizo ya moyo.

sourceString: These preliminary findings suggest that in the United States, persons with underlying health conditions or other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at a higher risk for severe disease from COVID-19 than are persons without these conditions.
targetString: Matokeo haya ya awali yanapendekeza kwamba nchini Marekani, watu walio na hali sugu za afya au vigezo vingine vinayotambuliwa vya hatari kwa ajili ya matokeo mabaya kutokana na maambukizi ya pumu wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa zaidi ya ugonjwa mbaya kutoka COVID-19 kuliko watu bila hali hizi.

sourceString: Data from laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases reported to CDC from 50 states, four U.S. territories and affiliated islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City with February 12–March 28, 2020 onset dates were analyzed.
targetString: Data kutoka visa vya COVID-19 vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara zilizoripotiwa kwa CDC kutoka majimbo 50, himaya nne za Marekani na visiwa husiani, Wilaya ya Kolombia na Jiji la New York zikiwa na tarehe za kuanza baina ya 12 Februari - 28 Machi 2020, zilichanganuliwa.

sourceString: Cases among persons repatriated to the United States from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship were excluded.
targetString: Visa miongoni mwa watu waliorejeshwa nyumbani nchini Marekani kutoka Wuhan, China na meli ya Diamond Princess havikujumuishwa.

sourceString: For cases with missing onset dates, date of onset was estimated by subtracting 4 days (median interval from symptom onset to specimen collection date among cases with known dates in these data) from the earliest specimen collection.
targetString: Katika visa vilivyokosa tarehe ya kuanza, tarehe ya kuanza ilikadiriwa kwa kuondoa siku 4 (muda wa kati kutoka kuanza kwa dalili hadi kukusanywa kwa data miongoni kwa visa vilivyo na tarehe zinazojulikana kwenye data hizi) kutoka wakati mapema zaidi sampuli ilipokusanywa.

sourceString: Public health departments reported cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that captures information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease (inclusive of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], and emphysema); diabetes mellitus; cardiovascular disease; chronic renal disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised condition; neurologic disorder, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disability; pregnancy; current smoking status; former smoking status; or other chronic disease.
targetString: Idara za afya ya umma ziliripoti visa kwa CDC kwa kutumia fomu ya kawaida ya kuripoti visa ambayo ilinakili taarifa (ndiyo, la au haijulikani) kuhusu hali zifuatazo na vigezo vinavyoweza kuwa hatari: ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu (ikiwa ni pamoja na matatizo ya kupumua, ugonjwa sugu wa kufungwa kwa mishipa ya damu [CPD] na kukatika pumu); kisukari; ugonjwa wa moyo; ugonjwa sugu wa njia ya mkojo; ugonjwa sugu wa maini; hali ya kuingiliwa kwa kinga ya mwili; matatizo ya kiakili, ukuaji wa kiakili au ulemavu wa kiakili; ujauzito; hali ya sasa ya kutumia sigara; hali ya zamani ya kutumia sigara au magonjwa mengine sugu.

sourceString: Data reported to CDC are preliminary and can be updated by health departments over time; critical data elements might be missing at the time of initial report; thus, this analysis is descriptive, and no statistical comparisons could be made.
targetString: Data zilizoripotiwa kwa CDC ni za awali na zinazoweza kusasishwa na idara ya afya muda baada ya muda; vipengele muhimu vya data vinaweza kukosekana wakati wa ripoti ya awali; hivyo, uchanganuzi huu ni fafanuzi na hakuna ulinganisho wa kitakwimu ambao ungeweza kufanywa.

sourceString: The percentages of patients of all ages with underlying health conditions who were not hospitalized, hospitalized without ICU admission, and hospitalized with ICU admission were calculated.
targetString: Hesabu ya asilimia ya wagonjwa wa umri zote waliokuwa na hali sugu za afya ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini, waliolazwa hospitalini bila kuwekwa katika chumba cha kushughulikiwa wagonjwa mahututi ICU na waliolazwa hospitalini kwenye chumba cha kushughulikiwa wagonjwa mahututi ICU ilipigwa.

sourceString: Percentages of hospitalizations with and without ICU admission were estimated for persons aged ≥19 years with and without underlying health conditions.
targetString: Makadirio ya asilimia ya wagonjwa waliolazwa hospitalini kwa kulazwa au bila kulazwa katika chumba cha wagonjwa walio katika hali mahututi wenye umri wa ≥19 waliokuwa na wasiokuwa na hali sugu yalifanywa.

sourceString: This part of the analysis was limited to persons aged ≥19 years because of the small sample size of cases in children with reported underlying health conditions (N = 32).
targetString: Sehemu hii ya uchanganuzi ulifanywa kwa watu wenye umri wa ≥19 pekee kwa sababu ya sampuli ndogo ya visa vya watoto waliokuwa na hali sugu zilizoripotiwa (N = 32).

sourceString: To account for missing data among these preliminary reports, ranges were estimated with a lower bound including cases with both known and unknown status for hospitalization with and without ICU admission as the denominator and an upper bound using only cases with known outcome status as the denominator.
targetString: Ili kuwajibikia ukosefu wa data miongoni mwa ripoti za awali, tofauti zilikadiriwa huku upeo wa chini zaidi ukijumuisha visa vinavyojulikana na visivyojulikana vya hali ya watu kulazwa hospitalini ama kwa matibabu ya watu walio katika hali mahututi au la kama kigezo msingi na upeo wa juu ukitumia tu visa vilivyo na matokeo yanayojulikana kama kigezo msingi.

sourceString: Because of small sample size and missing data on underlying health conditions among COVID-19 patients who died, case-fatality rates for persons with and without underlying conditions were not estimated.
targetString: Kwa sababu ya kiwango kidogo cha sampuli na kutokuwepo kwa data kuhusu hali sugu za afya miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19 waliofariki, viwango vya vifo vya kila kisa kwa watu walio na, na wasio na hali sugu za afya havikukadiriwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases (Figure) and 2,112 deaths were reported to CDC.
targetString: Kufikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, jumla ya visa 122,653 vilivyothibitishwa kwenye mahabara (Picha) na vifo 2,122 viliripotiwa kwa CDC.

sourceString: Case report forms were submitted to CDC for 74,439 (60.7%) cases.
targetString: Fomu za kuripoti visa zilizowasilishwa kwa CDC kwa ajili ya visa 74,439 (60.7%).

sourceString: Data on presence or absence of underlying health conditions and other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) were available for 7,162 (5.8%) patients (Table 1).
targetString: Data kuhusu kuwepo au kutokuwepo kwa hali sugu za afya na vigezo vingine vya hatari vinavyoweza kutambuliwa kwa ajili ya matokeo ya hali mbaya kutokana na maambukizi ya njia ya pumu (yaani., uvutaji sigara na ujauzito) zilipatikana kwa wagonjwa 7,162 (5.8%) (Jedwali la 1).

sourceString: Approximately one third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%), had at least one underlying condition or risk factor.
targetString: Takriban thuluthi moja ya wagonjwa hawa (2,692, 37.6%), walikuwa na angalau hali moja sugu au kigezo cha hatari.

sourceString: Diabetes mellitus (784, 10.9%), chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%), and cardiovascular disease (647, 9.0%) were the most frequently reported conditions among all cases.
targetString: Kisukari (784, 10.9%), ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu (656, 9.2%) na ugnjwa wa moyo (647, 9.0%) ndizo hali zilizoripotia mara nyingi zaidi kati ya visa vyote.

sourceString: Among 457 ICU admissions and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalizations, 358 (78%) and 732 (71%), respectively occurred among persons with one or more reported underlying health condition.
targetString: Miongoni mwa watu 457 waliolazwa katika Chumba cha watu Mahututi na 1,037 ambao walilazwa hospitalini lakini sio katika chumba cha watu mahututi, 358 (78%) na 732 (71%), mtawalia ulitokea miongoni mwa watu walioripoti hali moja au zaidi sugu ya kiafya.

sourceString: In contrast, 1,388 of 5,143 (27%) COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized were reported to have at least one underlying health condition.
targetString: Ikilinganishwa, idadi ya wagonjwa 1,388 kati ya 5,143 (27%) wa COVID-19 ambao hawakulazwa hospitalini waliripotiwa kuwa na angalau hali moja sugu ya kiafya.

sourceString: Among patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of non-ICU hospitalizations was higher among those with underlying health conditions (27.3%–29.8%) than among those without underlying health conditions (7.2%–7.8%); the percentage of cases that resulted in an ICU admission was also higher for those with underlying health conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than those without these conditions (2.2%–2.4%) (Table 2).
targetString: Miongoni mwa wagojwa wenye umri wa miaka ≥19, asilimia ya wagonjwa waliolazwa hospitalini bila kuweka katika chumba cha ICU ilikuwa juu zaidi (27.3%–29.8%) kwa watu ambao walikuwa na hali sugu za afya kuliko kwa wale ambao hawakuwa na hali sugu za afya (7.2%–7.8%); asilimia ya visa vilivyosababisha wagonjwa kulazwa kwenye ICU pia ilikuwa juu kwa watu waliokuwa na hali sugu za afya kwa (13.3%–14.5%) kuliko wale ambao hawakuwa na hali hizi (2.2%–2.4%) (Jedwali la 2).

sourceString: Small numbers of COVID-19 patients aged < 19 years were reported to be hospitalized (48) or admitted to an ICU (eight).
targetString: Idadi ndogo ya wagonjwa wa COVID-19 walio na umri wa < 19 waliripotiwa kulazwa hospitalini (48) au kulazwa katika chumba cha watu walio katika hali mahututi ICU (wanane).

sourceString: In contrast, 335 patients aged < 19 years were not hospitalized and 1,342 had missing data on hospitalization.
targetString: Kwa ulinganifu, wagonjwa 335 wenye umri wa miaka chini ya < 19 hawakulazwa hopitalini na 1,342 hawakuwa na data yoyote kuhusu kulazwa hospitalini.

sourceString: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying conditions or risk factors, 184 deaths occurred (all among patients aged ≥19 years); 173 deaths (94%) were reported among patients with at least one underlying condition.
targetString: Miongoni mwa wagonjwa wote wa COVID-19 walio na maelezo kamili kuhusu hali sugu au vigezo vya hatari, vifo 184 vilitokea (vyote miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa umri wa miaka ≥19); vifo 173 (94%) viliripotiwa miongoni mwa wagonjwa wenye angalau hali moja sugu.

sourceString: Among 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC as of March 28, 2020, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data available pertaining to underlying health conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, higher percentages of patients with underlying conditions were admitted to the hospital and to an ICU than patients without reported underlying conditions.
targetString: Miongoni mwa visa 122,653 vya COVID-19 nchini Marekani vilivyoripotiwa kwa CDC kuikia tarehe 28 Machi 2020, wagonjwa 7,162 (5.8%) walikuwa na data kuhusiana na hali sugu ya afya au uwezekano wa kuwepo vigezo vya hatari; miongonimwa wagonjwa hawa, asilimia ya juu ya wagonjwa wenye hali sugu za afya ililazwa hospitalini na kwenye ICU kuliko wagonjwa ambao hawakuwa na hali sugu.

sourceString: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, which suggest that patients with underlying health conditions and risk factors, including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic renal disease, and smoking, might be at higher risk for severe disease or death from COVID-19.
targetString: Matokeo haya yanaambatana na matokeo kutoka China na Italia, ambayo yanaashiria kwamba wagonjwa wenye hali sugu za afya na vigezo vya hatari, ikiwa ni pamoja lakini sio tu, kisukari, mshtuko wa moyo, COPD, ugonjwa wa moyo, ugonjwa wa ubongo, ugonjwa sugu wa njia ya mkojo na uvutaji sigara, huenda wakawa katika hatari kuwa zaidi ya kupata ugonjwa mbaya au kufa kutokana na COVID-19.

sourceString: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data because of the burden placed on reporting health departments with rapidly rising case counts, and these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Uchanganuzi huu ulikumbwa na changamoto kutokana na idadi ndogo na kukosekana kwa data kwa sababu ya uzito uliowekewa idara za afya zinazoripoti kukiwa na idadi inayoongezeka haraka ya visa na matokeo haya yanaweza kubadilika data ya ziada ikiendelea kupatikana.

sourceString: It is not yet known whether the severity or level of control of underlying health conditions affects the risk for severe disease associated with COVID-19.
targetString: Bado haijulikani iwapo uzito au kiwango cha udhibiti wa hali sugu za afya huathiri hatari ya ugonjwa mbaya unaohusiana na COVID-19.

sourceString: Many of these underlying health conditions are common in the United States: based on self-reported 2018 data, the prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1%, and the U.S. age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease (excluding hypertension without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017.
targetString: Hali nyingi hizi sugu ziliripotiwa nchini Marekani: kulingana na data ya walioripoti wenyewe ya 2018, maambukizi ya visa vya kisukari vilivyopimwa miongoni mwa watu wazima nchini Marekani yalikuwa 10.1% na maambukizi yaliyorekebishwa kulingana na umri nchini Marekani miongoni mwa aina zote za magonjwa ya moyo (bila kujumuisha mshtuko wa moyo bila ugonjwa mwingine wa moyo) yalikuwa 10.6% mwaka 2017.

sourceString: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the U.S. estimated prevalence of current asthma among persons of all ages was 7.9%.
targetString: Maambukizi yaliyorekebishwa kulingana na umri ya COPD miongoni mwa watu wazima nchini Marekani ni 5.9% na mnamo 2018, Marekani ilikadiria maambukizi ya ugonjwa wa pumu miongoni mwa watu wa umri wote ulikuwa 7.9%.

sourceString: CDC continues to develop and update resources for persons with underlying health conditions to reduce the risk of acquiring COVID-19.
targetString: CDC inaendelea kuunda na kusasisha rasilimali kwa ajili ya watu walio na hali sugu za afya ili kupunguza hatari ya kupata COVID-19.

sourceString: The estimated higher prevalence of these conditions among those in this early group of U.S. COVID-19 patients and the potentially higher risk for more severe disease from COVID-19 associated with the presence of underlying conditions highlight the importance of COVID-19 prevention in persons with underlying conditions.
targetString: Maambukizi mengi yaliyokadiriwa ya hali hizi miongoni mwa wale walio katika kikundi hiki cha mapema cha wagonjwa wa COVID-19 nchini Marekani na uwezekano wa hatari ya juu wa ugonjwa mbaya zaidi COVID-19 kutokana na kuwepo kwa hali sugu ukiangazia umuhimu wa kuzuia COVID-19 miongoni mwa watu walio na hali sugu za afya.

sourceString: The findings in this report are subject to at least six limitations.
targetString: Matokeo katika ripoti hii yanakabiliwa na angalau vizuizi sita.

sourceString: First, these data are preliminary, and the analysis was limited by missing data related to the health department reporting burden associated with rapidly rising case counts and delays in completion of information requiring medical chart review; these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Kwanza, data hii ni ya awali na uchanganuzi wake ulikuwa na vizuizi kutokana na kukosekana kwa data inayohusiana na idara ya afya kuripoti mzigo unaohusiana na idadi ya visa inayoendelea kukua na kucheleweshwa kukamilishwa kwa maelezo yanayohitaji ukaguzi wa chati ya kimatibabu; matokeo haya yanaweza kubadilika data ya ziada ikiendelea kupatikana.

sourceString: Information on underlying conditions was only available for 7,162 (5.8%) of 122,653 cases reported to CDC.
targetString: Maelezo kuhusu hali sugu yalikuwa yanapatikana kwa visa 7,162 (5.8%) kati ya 122,653 vilivyoripotiwa kwa CDC.

sourceString: It cannot be assumed that those with missing information are similar to those with data on either hospitalizations or underlying health conditions.
targetString: Haiwezi kuchukuliwa kuwa wale ambao maelezo yao hayapo ni sawa na wale walio na data kuhusu kulazwa hospitalini au hali sugu za afya.

sourceString: Second, these data are subject to bias in outcome ascertainment because of short follow-up time.
targetString: Pili, huenda data hii ina mapendeleo katika kuthibitisha matokeo kwa sababu ya muda mfupi wa kufuatilia.

sourceString: Some outcomes might be underestimated, and long-term outcomes cannot be assessed in this analysis.
targetString: Baadhi ya matokeo huenda yakakosa kupewa uzito nayo matokeo ya muda mrefu hayawezi kutathminiwa katika uchanganuzi huu.

sourceString: Third, because of the limited availability of testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis is likely biased toward more severe cases, and findings might change as testing becomes more widespread.
targetString: Tatu, kwa sababu ya kiwango cha chini cha vipimo katika maeneo mengi katika wakati huu, uchanganuzi huu huenda ukaegemea visa vibaya zaidi na matokeo yanaweza kubadilika vipimo vikiendelea katika maeneo mengi.

sourceString: Fourth, because of the descriptive nature of these data, attack rates among persons with and without underlying health conditions could not be compared, and thus the risk difference of severe disease with COVID-19 between these groups could not be estimated.
targetString: Nne, kwa sababu ya hali ya kiufafanuzi ya data hizi, viwango vya mashambulizi miongoni mwa watu walio na wasio na hali sugu za afya havingeweza kulinganisha na hivyo tofauti ya hatari ya ugonjwa mbaya pamoja COVID-19 kati ya vikundi hivi haingeweza kukadiriwa.

sourceString: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn about underlying conditions that were not included in the case report form or about different conditions that were reported in a single, umbrella category.
targetString: Tano, hakuna mahitimisho ambayo yangetolewa kuhusu hali sugu ambazo hazikujumuishwa kwenye fomu ya kuripoti visa au kuhusu hali tofauti ambazo ziliripotiwa katika kategoria moja ya jumla.

sourceString: For example, asthma and COPD were included in a chronic lung disease category.
targetString: Kwa mfano, magonjwa ya pumu na COPD yalijumuishwa kwenye kategoria ya ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu.

sourceString: Finally, for some underlying health conditions and risk factors, including neurologic disorders, chronic liver disease, being a current smoker, and pregnancy, few severe outcomes were reported; therefore, conclusions cannot be drawn about the risk for severe COVID-19 among persons in these groups.
targetString: Hatimaye, kwa baadhi ya hali sugu za afya na vigezo vya hatari, ikiwa ni pamoja na matatizo ya kinyurolojia, ugonjwa sugu wa ini, matumizi ya sigara kwa sasa na ujauzito, matokeo machache ya hali mbaya yaliripotiwa; kwa hivyo, mahitimisho hayawezi kuafikiwa kuhusu hatari ya magonjwa haya kwa COVID-19 miongoni mwa watu walio katika vikundi hivi.

sourceString: Persons in the United States with underlying health conditions appear to be at higher risk for more severe COVID-19, consistent with findings from other countries.
targetString: Watu walio Marekani walio na hali sugu za afya wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa zaidi kupata hali mbaya ya COVID-19, kuambatana na matokeo kutoka katika nchi nyingine.

sourceString: Persons with underlying health conditions who have symptoms of COVID-19, including fever, cough, or shortness of breath, should immediately contact their health care provider.
targetString: Watu walio na hali sugu za afya ambao wana dalili za COVID-19, ikiwa ni pamoja na joto jingi mwilini, kikohozi au ugumu wa kupumua, wanapaswa kuwasiliana na mtoa huduma wao wa afya mara moja.

sourceString: These persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19, through washing their hands; cleaning and disinfecting high-touch surfaces; and social distancing, including staying at home, avoiding crowds, gatherings, and travel, and avoiding contact with persons who are ill.
targetString: Watu hawa wanapaswa kuchukua hatua ili kujilinda dhidi ya COVID-19, kuosha mikono yao; kusafisha na kuua viini katika sehemu zinazoguswa sana; na kujiweka mbali ya watu, ikiwa ni pamoja na kukaa nyumbani, kuepuka mikutano ya hadhara, mikusanyiko ya watu, na usafiri, na kuepuka kugusana na watu ambao ni wagonjwa.

sourceString: Maintaining at least a 30-day supply of medication, a 2-week supply of food and other necessities, and knowledge of COVID-19 symptoms are recommended for those with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Kudumisha usambazaji wa huduma za matibabu kwa angalau siku 30, usambazaji wa chakula na mahitaji mengine muhimu kwa wiki 2 na kufahamu dalili za COVID-19 kunapendekezwa kwa watu walio na hali sugu za afya.

sourceString: All persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19 and to protect others.
targetString: Watu wote wanapaswa kuchukua hatua ili kujilinda kutokana na COVID-19 na kuwalinda wengine.

sourceString: All persons who are ill should stay home, except to get medical care; should not go to work; and should stay away from others.
targetString: Watu wote ambao ni wagonjwa wanapaswa kukaa nyumbani, isipokuwa wakienda kutafuta matibabu, hawapaswi kuenda kazini na wanapaswa kukaa mbali ya watu wengine.

sourceString: This is especially important for those who work with persons with underlying conditions or who otherwise are at high risk for severe outcomes from COVID-19.
targetString: Hii ni muhimu hasa kwa wale walio karibu na watu walio na hali sugu au vinginevyo walio katika hatari kubwa ya matokeo mabaya kutokana na COVID-19.

sourceString: Community mitigation strategies, which aim to slow the spread of COVID-19, are important to protect all persons from COVID-19, especially persons with underlying health conditions and other persons at risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).
targetString: Mikakati ya kukabiliana ya jumuiya, inayolenga kupunguza kuenea kwa COVID-19, ni muhimu kulinda watu wote dhidi ya COVID-19, hasa watu walio na hali sugu za afya na watu wengine walio hatarini ugonjwa hatari unaohusiana na COVID-19 (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).

sourceString: What is already known about this topic?
targetString: Ni nini ambacho tayari kinafahamika kuhusu mada hii?

sourceString: Published reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe COVID-19 disease include underlying health conditions, but data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Ripoti zilizochapishwa kutoka China na Italia zinapendekeza kwamba vigezo vya hatari kwa ugonjwa hatari wa COVID-19 ikiwa ni pamoja na hali sugu za afya, lakini inayofafanua hali sugu za afya miongoni mwa wagonjwa wa COVID-19 nchini Marekani haijaripotiwa.

sourceString: What is added by this report?
targetString: Ripoti hii inaongeza nini?

sourceString: Based on preliminary U.S. data, persons with underlying health conditions such as diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease, appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease than persons without these conditions.
targetString: Kulingana na data ya awali ya Marekani, watu walio na hali sugu za afya kama vile kisukari, ugonjwa sugu wa mapafu na ugonjwa wa moyo, wanaonekana kuwa katika hatari kubwa wa ugonjwa mbaya unaohusiana na COVID-19 kuliko watu bila hali hizi.

sourceString: What are the implications for public health practice?
targetString: Je athari zake kwa matendo ya afya ya umma ni zipi?

sourceString: Strategies to protect all persons and especially those with underlying health conditions, including social distancing and handwashing, should be implemented by all communities and all persons to help slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Mikakati ya kulinda watu wote na hasa wale walio na hali sugu za afya, ikiwa ni pamoja na kukaa mbali ya watu na kuosha mikono, inapaswa kutekelezwa na jumuiya zote na watu wote ili kusaidia kupunguza kuenea kwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Emergence of a Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19): Protocol for Extending Surveillance Used by the Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Centre and Public Health England
targetString: Kuibuka kwa Virusi vipya vya korona (COVID-19): Utaratibu wa Kuendeleza Uchunguzi Unaotumiwa na Chuo cha Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Center pamoja na Public Health England

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) and Public Health England (PHE) have successfully worked together on the surveillance of influenza and other infectious diseases for over 50 years, including three previous pandemics.
targetString: Chuo cha Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) na Public Health England (PHE) vimefanikiwa kufanya kazi pamoja katika kuchunguza homa ya mafua na magonjwa mengine ya kuambukizana kwa muda wa miaka 50, ikiwa ni pamoja na majanga matatu yaliyopita.

sourceString: With the emergence of the international outbreak of the coronavirus infection (COVID-19), a UK national approach to containment has been established to test people suspected of exposure to COVID-19.
targetString: Kutokana na kuibuka kwa mkurupuko wa maambukizi ya virusi vya korona (COVID-19) kote ulimwenguni, mwelekeo wa kitaifa wa Uingereza umewekwa ili kupima watu wanaoshukiwa kuwa hatarini kupata COVID-19.

sourceString: At the same time and separately, the RCGP RSC's surveillance has been extended to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community as well as assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: Wakati huo huo, uchunguzi wa RCGP RSC umeendelea kutumika kivyake ili kufuatilia kusambaa kimuda na kijiografia kwa maambukizi ya COVID-19 katika jamii pamoja na kutathmini ufanisi wa mkakati wa udhibiti.

sourceString: The aims of this study are to surveil COVID-19 in both asymptomatic populations and ambulatory cases with respiratory infections, ascertain both the rate and pattern of COVID-19 spread, and assess the effectiveness of the containment policy.
targetString: Malengo ya utafiti hii ni kuchunguza COVID-19 miongoni mwa watu ambao hawana dalili pamoja na visa vya ulemavu wa kutembea na maambukizi ya pumu, kuhakikisha viwango na mtindo wa kuenea kwa COVID-19 na kutathmini ufanisi wa sera ya udhibiti.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, a network of over 500 general practices in England, extract pseudonymized data weekly.
targetString: RCGP RSC, mtandao wa zaidi ya huduma 500 za jumla nchini Uingereza, hukusanya data isiyotambulishwa kila wiki.

sourceString: This extended surveillance comprises of five components: (1) Recording in medical records of anyone suspected to have or who has been exposed to COVID-19.
targetString: Uchunguzi huu ulioendelezwa unajumuisha sehemu tano: (1) Kurekodi kwenye rekodi za kimatibabu mtu yeyote anayeshukiwa kuwa au ambaye amekuwa hatarini kupata COVID-19.

sourceString: Computerized medical records suppliers have within a week of request created new codes to support this.
targetString: Watoa huduma za rekodi za matibabu zinazozalishwa na kompyuta wameunda misimbo mipya ya kusaidia huduma hii ndani ya wiki moja ya kuombwa kufanya hivyo.

sourceString: (2) Extension of current virological surveillance and testing people with influenza-like illness or lower respiratory tract infections (LRTI)—with the caveat that people suspected to have or who have been exposed to COVID-19 should be referred to the national containment pathway and not seen in primary care.
targetString: (2) Kuendelezwa kwa uchunguzi wa sasa wa kivirolojia na kupima watu walio na ugonjwa unaofanana na homa ya mafua au maambukizi ya njia ya chini ya pumu (LRTI)—kwa tahadhari kwamba watu wanashukiwa kuwa au ambao wamekuwa hatarini kupata COVID-19 wanapaswa kupaswa kupelekwa katika vituo vya kidhibiti vya kitaifa badala ya kupewa tiba ya kimsingi.

sourceString: (3) Serology sample collection across all age groups.
targetString: (3) Ukusanyaji wa sampuli za serolojia miongoni mwa vikundi vya umri wote.

sourceString: This will be an extra blood sample taken from people who are attending their general practice for a scheduled blood test.
targetString: Hii itakuwa sampuli ya damu ya ziada itakayochukuliwa kutoka kwa watu wanaotafuta huduma za kawaida kwa ajili ya vipimo vilivyoratibiwa vya damu.

sourceString: The 100 general practices currently undertaking annual influenza virology surveillance will be involved in the extended virological and serological surveillance.
targetString: Huduma 100 za kawaida ambazo kwa sasa zinafanya uchunguzi wa kila mwaka wa vairolojia ya homa ya mafua itahusika katika kuendelezwa kwa uchunguzi wa kivairolojia na serolojia.

sourceString: (4) Collecting convalescent serum samples.
targetString: (4) Ukusanyaji wa sampuli za serami za watu wanaopona.

sourceString: We have the opportunity to escalate the data extraction to twice weekly if needed.
targetString: Tunaweza kuongeza muda wa uopoaji wa data hadi mara mbili kila wiki ikihitajika.

sourceString: Swabs and sera will be analyzed in PHE reference laboratories.
targetString: Sampuli na serami zitachunguzwa katika mahabari husika za PHE.

sourceString: General practice clinical system providers have introduced an emergency new set of clinical codes to support COVID-19 surveillance.
targetString: Watoa huduma wa kawaida wa mfumo wa kliniki wamezindua kwa dharura kikundi kipya cha misimbo ya kikliniki ya kusaidia katika uchunguzi wa COVID-19.

sourceString: Additionally, practices participating in current virology surveillance are now taking samples for COVID-19 surveillance from low-risk patients presenting with LRTIs.
targetString: Isitoshe, huduma zinazoshiriki katika uchunguzi wa sasa wa viarolojia sasa zinachukua sampuli kwa ajili ya uchunguzi wa COVID-19 kutoka kwa wagonjwa wenye hatari ya chini wanaoonyesha maambukizi ya njia ya chini ya pumu.

sourceString: Within the first 2 weeks of setup of this surveillance, we have identified 3 cases: 1 through the new coding system, the other 2 through the extended virology sampling.
targetString: Ndani ya wiki 2 za kwanza za kuweka mipangilio ya uchunguzi huu, tumetambua visa 3: 1 kupitia mfumo mpya wa kuweka msimbo, vingine 2 kupitia kuendelea kuchukuliwa kwa sampuli ya viarolojia.

sourceString: We have rapidly converted the established national RCGP RSC influenza surveillance system into one that can test the effectiveness of the COVID-19 containment policy.
targetString: Tumeweza kubadilisha haraka mfumo wa kitaifa wa kufuatilia homa ya mafua wa RCGP RSC ukawa mfumo unaoweza kupima ufaafu wa sera ya kudhibiti COVID-19.

sourceString: The extended surveillance has already seen the use of new codes with 3 cases reported.
targetString: Uchunguzi ulioendelezwa tayari umesababisha matumizi ya misimbo mipya huku visa 3 vikiripotiwa.

sourceString: Rapid sharing of this protocol should enable scientific critique and shared learning.
targetString: Kushirikiwa haraka kwa utaratibu huu unapaswa kuwezesha uhakiki wa kisanyansi na mafunzo ya pamoja.

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) is a network of general practices (GPs) with a nationally representative population that provides pseudonymized data for weekly surveillance of infectious diseases.
targetString: Chuo cha Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) ni mtandao wa huduma za kawaida (GPs) yenye idadi ya watu kutoka sehemu zote za nchi wanaotoa data isiyotambulishwa kwa ajili ya uchunguzi wa kila wa magonjwa ya kuambukizana.

sourceString: The disease surveillance program is commissioned by Public Health England (PHE) and covers 37 infectious diseases, including influenza.
targetString: Mpango wa uchunguzi wa ugonjwa unafadhiliwa na Public Health England (PHE) na huhusisha magonjwa 37 ya kuambukizana, ikiwa ni pamoja homa ya mafua.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC and PHE have an established collaboration of over 50 years in influenza and respiratory disease surveillance and are now in their 53rd season of surveillance and analysis.
targetString: RCGP RSC na PHE zimeshirikiana kwa zaidi ya miaka 50 katika uchunguzi wa homa ya mafua na magonjwa ya pumu na sasa zimo katika msimu wao wa 53 wa uchunguzi na uchanganuzi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC extracts pseudonymized data from a nationally representative sample of over 500 urban and nonurban GPs each week covering a population of over 4 million.
targetString: RCGP RSC huopoa data isiyotambulishwa kutoka kwa sampuli wakilishi ya kitaifa ya zaidi ya watu 500 wa mjini na wasio wa mjini kila wiki na hii inahusisha zaidi ya watu milioni 4.

sourceString: Data from these practices are reported online in a weekly return, which includes monitoring weekly rates of influenza-like illness (ILI) and other communicable and respiratory diseases in England.
targetString: Data kutoka katika huduma hizi zinaripotiwa mtandaoni kila wiki, ikiwa ni pamoja na kufuatilia viwango vya kila wiki vya ugonjwa unaofanana na homa ya mafua (ILI) na magonjwa mengine ya kuambukizana na ya pumu nchini Uingereza.

sourceString: We also produce an annual report.
targetString: Pia tunatoa ripoti ya kila mwaka.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC data set includes all coded data and all prescribed items including vaccine exposure.
targetString: Seti ya data ya RCGP RSC inajumuisha data yote iliyosimbwa na bidhaa zote zilizopendekezwa ikiwa ni pamoja na matumizi ya chanjo.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC conducts virology surveillance each influenza season, with 100 GPs participating in the 2019-2020 season (Figure 1).
targetString: RCGP RSC huendesha uchunguzi wa vairolojia kila msimu wa homa ya mafua, wahudumu 100 wakishiriki katika msimu wa 2019-2020 (Picha ya 1).

sourceString: These virology sampling practices are also recruited to be nationally representative (Figure 1).
targetString: Huduma za kuchukua sampuli za vairolojia pia ziliteuliwa kuwakilisha taifa nzima (Picha ya 1).

sourceString: GPs take nasopharyngeal swabs from persons showing acute respiratory illness within 7 days of the onset of symptoms.
targetString: Wahudumu wanachukua sampuli za puani kutoka kwa watu wanaopnyesha ungonjwa mbaya wa pumu ndani ya siku 7 za kuanza kwa dalili.

sourceString: Nasopharyngeal swabs are taken from children younger than 5 years showing symptoms of acute bronchitis or bronchiolitis.
targetString: Chembe zinazotolewa puani kutoka kwa watoto walio na umri wa chini ya miaka 5 zinaoonyesha dalili za ugonjwa sugu wa mikamba ya kupumua.

sourceString: Additionally, nasopharyngeal samples are taken from anyone 5 years and older showing acute onset of ILI and respiratory synctial virus.
targetString: Vilevile, sampuli zinazochukuliwa puani zinachukuliwa kutoka kwa mtu yeyote mwenye umri wa miaka 5 na zaidi anayeonyesha mwanzo wa hali mbaya ya ILI na virusi vya pumu.

sourceString: Swabs are tested at the PHE Respiratory Virus Unit for influenza to monitor positivity rates and circulating strains, as well as for measuring vaccine effectiveness.
targetString: Sampuli zinapimwa katika Kitengo cha Virusi vya Pumu PHE kwa ajili homa ya mafua ili kufuatilia viwango vya kuwepo kwa ugonjwa na aina zinazosambaa, pamoja na kupima chanjo kwa ufanisi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC successfully conducted a pilot collecting serological samples from adults and linking them to a patient's medical records during the 2018-2019 influenza season.
targetString: The RCGP RSC ilifanikiwa kuendesha jaribio la kukusanya sampuli za kiserolojia kutoka kwa watu wazima na kuzihusisha na kwenye rekodi za kimatibabu za wagonjwa wakati wa mkurupuko wa homa ya mafua msimu wa 2018-2019.

sourceString: This pilot was in collaboration with the PHE Seroepidemiology Unit and added to the residual blood samples submitted to PHE by National Health Service (NHS) laboratories.
targetString: Jaribio hili lilifanywa kwa ushirikiano na Kitengo cha Seroepidemiolojia ya PHE na kuongezea kwenye sampuli zilizokuwa za damu zilizowasilishwa kwa PHE na mahabara za Huduma ya Afya ya Kitaifa (HHS).

sourceString: Serology can provide important information about background population immunity, and sentinel networks can provide a mechanism for systematic data collection and linkage to medical records and health outcomes.
targetString: Serolojia inaweza kutoa maelezo muhimu kuhusu usuli wa kinga ya mwili ya watu, na mitandao ya maelezo inaweza kutoa utaratibu wa ukusanyaji wa data kimfumo na kuunganisha kwenye rekodi za kimatibabu na matokeo ya afya.

sourceString: The serology pilot has demonstrated the ability of the network to collect serology samples in adults.
targetString: Jaribio la serolojia limeonyesha uwezo wa mtandao huu kukusanya sampuli za serolojia kwa watu wazima.

sourceString: With the COVID-19 outbreak, PHE and RCGP RSC have adapted existing influenza surveillance to monitor the spread of COVID-19 in the community, and this protocol sets out the basis for that collaboration.
targetString: Kukiwa na mkurupuko wa COVID-19, PHE na RCGP RSC zimeanza kutumia uchunguzi uliopo wa homa ya mafua ili kufuatilia kuenea kwa COVID-19 katika jamii na utaratibu huu unaweka bayana msingi wa ushirikiano huo.

sourceString: The primary national strategy for COVID-19 infection is containment, with patients who are at high risk managed via the telephone help system NHS111 and the PHE health protection teams, but the RCGP RSC surveillance is entirely separate.
targetString: Mkakati wa kimsingi wa kitaifa wa maambukizi ya COVID-19 ni kuudhibiti, huku wagonjwa walio katika hatari kubwa zaidi wakifuatiliwa kupitia mfumo wa usaidizi wa njia ya simu NHS111 timu za ulinzi wa kiafya za PHE, lakini uchunguzi wa RCGP RSC ni tofauti kikamilifu.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, by extending its established work, will provide virological and serological surveillance to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community, and assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: RCGP RSC, kwa kuendeleza kazi yake iliyowekwa, itatoa huduma ya uchunguzi wa kivairolojia na kiserolojia ili kufuatilia kusambaa kwa COVID-19 kiwakati na kieneo katika jamii, na kuthamini ufanisi wa mkakati wa udhibiti.

sourceString: We would not be working in isolation on this research.
targetString: Hatutafanya kazi pekee yetu katika utafiti huu.

sourceString: We will share the protocol with UK colleagues and the I-MOVE consortium who have recently obtained EU Horizon 2020 funding from the stream “Advancing knowledge for the clinical and public health response to the novel coronavirus epidemic”.
targetString: Tutashiriki utaratibu huu na wenzetu nchini Uingereza na jumuiya ya I-MOVE ambao hivi majuzi wamepokea ufadhili kutoka kwa EU Horizon 2020 kwa “Kuendeleza ujuzi wa jinsi ya kukabiliana na virusi vya korona kimatibabu na afya ya umma”.

sourceString: It is anticipated that great efficiencies in project management will result through this collaboration than that obtained from countries acting alone.
targetString: Inatarajiwa kuwa ufanisi mkubwa katika usimamizi wa mradi utatokea kupitia ushirikiano huu kuliko ule uliopo katika nchi zinazofanya kazi pekee yao.

sourceString: The aim of this study is to identify whether there is undetected community transmission of COVID-19, estimate population susceptibility, and monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community.
targetString: Lengo la utafiti huu ni kutambua iwapo kuna maambukizi ya jumuiya ambayo hayajagunduliwa ya COVID-19, makadirio ya watu kuwepo hatarini na kufuatilia kusambaa kwa COVID-19 kiwakati na kieneo katika jamii.

sourceString: The objectives of this study are as follows:
targetString: Malengo ya utafiti huu ni kama yafuatayo:

sourceString: To monitor the burden of suspected COVID-19 activity in the community through primary care surveillance and clinical coding of possible COVID-19 cases referred into the containment pathway
targetString: Kufuatilia uzito wa shughuli ya kushukiwa kwa COVID-19 kwenye jamii kupitia uchunguzi wa tiba ya kimsingi na kuwekewa msimbo visa vinavyoweza kuwa vya COVID-19 vinavyorejelewa kwenye njia ya udhibiti

sourceString: To provide virological evidence on the presence and extent of undetected community transmission of COVID-19 and monitor positivity rates among individuals presenting ILI or acute respiratory tract infections to primary care
targetString: Kutoa ushahidi wa kivairolojia kuhusu kuwepo na kiwango cha maambukizi ya COVID-19 ambayo hayajagunduliwa katika jamii na kufuatilia viwango vya visa vya maambukizi miongoni mwa watu wanaoonyesha ILI au maambukizi mabaya ya njia ya pumu kwa tiba ya kimsingi

sourceString: To estimate baseline susceptibility to COVID-19 in the community and estimate both symptomatic and asymptomatic exposure rates in the population through seroprevalence monitoring
targetString: Kukadiria hali ya kimsingi ya jamii kuwa hatarini kupata COVID-19 na kukadiria viwango vya kuwepo hatarini kwa dalili au bila dalili miongoni mwa watu kupitia ufuatiliaji wa viwango vya virusi kwenye serami

sourceString: To pilot implementation of a scheme for collection of convalescent sera with antibody profiles among recovered cases of COVID-19 discharged to the community
targetString: Kufanya jaribio la kutekeleza mbinu ya ukusanyaji wa serami kutoka kwa watu wanaopona kupitia wasifu wa antibodi miongoni watu waliopona kutokana na COVID-19 walioruhusiwa kurudi nyumbani.

sourceString: We intend to capture the following.
targetString: Tunalenga kunasa yafuatayo.

sourceString: Clinical workload related to reports of COVID-19 using the codes created to flag cases, those being assessed and where the infection is located are excluded (Figures 2-​-44)
targetString: Uzito wa kazi za kimatibabu zinazohusiana na ripoti za COVID-19 kwa kutumia misimbo iliyoundwa kutambua visa, vile vinavyotathminiwa na mahali maambukizi yametokea hazijajumuishwa (Picha 2--44)

sourceString: Foreign countries visited in the last 28 days
targetString: Nchi za kigeni ulizotembelea katika siku 28 zilizopita

sourceString: Existing codes that may have utility (Tables 1-​-3).3).
targetString: Misimbo iliyopo inayoweza kuwa na huduma muhimu (Majedwali ya 1-​-3).3).

sourceString: Many GPs and primary care teams may not realize that important relevant data can be coded.
targetString: Wengi wa hudumu na timu za tiba ya kimsingi huenda wasiweze kugundua kwamba data muhimu inaweza kusimbwa.

sourceString: There is also the potential during any pandemic to monitor the effectiveness of any transmission control measures.
targetString: Kuna pia uwezekano wakati wa janga kubwa wa kufuatilia ufanisi wa hatua zozote za kudhibiti kusambaa.

sourceString: Reliable coding of letters and test results that will show an infection has become either confirmed or excluded
targetString: Misimbo tegemewa ya herufi na matokeo ya vipimo yatakayoonyesha kwamba maambukizi ama yamethibitisha au hayajajumuishwa

sourceString: The methods will follow the approach used in the current influenza surveillance system and recent serology study, and includes five components: (1) primary care clinical surveillance; (2) virological surveillance; (3) population serological surveillance; (4) convalescent sera in cases; and (5) data curation.
targetString: Mbinu hizi zitafuata mwelekeo unaotumika katika mfumo wa sasa wa uchunguzi wa homa ya mafua na utafiti wa hivi majuzi wa serolojia, na ina sehemu tano: (1) uchunguzi wa kimatibabu wa tiba msingi; (2) uchunguzi wa kivairolojia; (3) uchunguzi wa kiserolojia wa watu; (4) serami katika visa vya watu wanaopona; na (5) upangaji na ujumuishaji wa data.

sourceString: The NHS uses the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT) system of coding, which is normally only updated twice annually.
targetString: NHS hutumia mfumo wa misimbo wa Majina ya Kimfumo ya Majina ya Kimatibabu (SNOMED CT), ambao kwa kawaida husasishwa mara bili pekee kila mwaka.

sourceString: There was added complexity as some computerized medical record (CMR) suppliers use the Read coding systems (Read clinical terms version 3 – CTv3), which is no longer updated.
targetString: Kulikuwa na hali changamano iliyoongezeka kwa kuwa baadhi ya watoa huduma za rekodi za matibabu zilizowekwa kwenye kompyuta (CRM) hutumia mifumo ya usimbaji ya Uliosomwa ( Toleo la majina yaliyosomwa ya kimatibabu 3 - CTv3), ambao hausaishwi tena.

sourceString: Additionally, there were no clinical codes to record COVID-19 in early February 2020.

sourceString: Therefore, the two main GP system suppliers added the five terms shown in Table 4 as system-wide local codes.

sourceString: A UK emergency release of SNOMED CT concepts for COVID-19 was also subsequently made available across all CMR systems (Table 4).
targetString: Toleo la dharura la Uingereza la dhana za SNOMED CT kwa ajili COVID-19 pia ulipatikana baadaye katika mifumo yote ya CMR (Jedwali la 4).

sourceString: The intention is that these will eventually be mapped to the new SNOMED CT concepts as they become available, allowing recording of relevant data (Multimedia Appendix 1).

sourceString: The key requirements for this release were the ability to code (Table 4) a case of COVID-19, exposure to risk of infection (travel to an area where there may be a higher risk), contact with anyone infected with COVID-19, a report that a person had been tested for COVID-19, and that the disease had been excluded (likely a negative test).
targetString: Mahitaji makuu ya toleo hili yalikuwa ni uwezo wa kusimba (Jedwali la 4) kisa cha COVID-19, kuwepo hatarini ya kupata maambukizi (kusafiri kuenda eneo ambapo kunaweza kuwa na hatari kubwa), kugusana na mtu yeyote aliyeambukizwa COVID-19, ripoti kwamba mtu amepimwa ugonjwa wa COVID-19 na kwamba ugonjwa haujajumuishwa (uwezekano wa kutokuwepo kwa ugonjwa).

sourceString: In addition, practices are now able to code any foreign travel undertaken, including the ability to record visits to multiple countries (implemented February 8, 2020).

targetString: Kwa sasa, sampuli za vairilojia za uchunguzi wa homa ya mafua zinaambatana na fomu ya kawaida ya ombi.

targetString: Tarehe ya kuanza kwa dalili

targetString: Vipimo vya yoyote kati ya yafuatayo:

sourceString: Acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis in those younger than five years
targetString: Matatizo ya mikamba ya kupumua kwa wale wenye umri wa chini ya miaka mitano

sourceString: Lower respiratory tract infection (LRTI)
targetString: Maambukizi ya njia ya chini ya pumu (LRTI)

targetString: Historia ya joto jingi mwilini (Y/N); iliyopimwa (Y/N); ikiwa ndiyo, kiwango

sourceString: Shortness of breath (Y/N), if measured: oxygen saturation and respiratory rate
targetString: Ugumu wa kupumua (Y/N), ikiwa imepimwa: kutumika kwa hewa safi na kiwango cha kupumua

targetString: Usafiri wa hivi majuzi (Y/N), ikiwa ndiyo, nchi zilizotembelewa katika siku 14 zilizopita

sourceString: Contact with a named person with confirmed COVID-19 (Y/N) with a free text comment about the level of certainty
targetString: Mgusano na mtu aliyetajwa kuthibitishwa kuwa na COVID-19 (Y/N) kwa maoni ya matini huru kuhusu kiwango cha uhakika

sourceString: These codes will be grouped ontologically into “definite”, “probable”, “possible”, and “not a case” using our standard approach to grouping codes (Table 5), which has been used previously across disease areas.
targetString: Misimbo hii itawekwa kwenye vikundi kiontolojia kuwa “halisi”, “huenda ikawa”, “vinawezekana” na “sio kisa” kwa kutumia mwelekeo wetu wa kawaida wa misimbo ya kuweka visa kwenye vikundi (Jedwali la 5), ambao umetumika awali kote katika maeneo ya ugonjwa.

sourceString: Public Presentation of Data Using an Observatory and Dashboards
targetString: Uwasilishaji wa Data kwa Umma kwa kutumia Nyenzo za Kutazama na Dashibodi

sourceString: We will develop an observatory to present data nationally and a dashboard for feedback to practices about their data quality and collection of virology and serology samples.
targetString: Tutaunda jukwaa la kimtazamo ili kuwasilisha data kitaifa na dashibodi ya majibu kwa vitendo kuusu ubora wao wa data na ukusanyaji wa sampuli za virolojia na serolojia.

sourceString: This is based on coding described in Table 4.
targetString: Hii ni kulingana na uwekaji msimbo uliofafanuliwa katika Jedwali la 4.

sourceString: Definite case will be presented on our dashboard as “cases” of COVID-19.
targetString: Visa halisi vitawasilishwa kwenye dashibodi yetu kama “visa” vya COVID-19.

sourceString: Possible cases will be presented as “Under investigation” (investigating).
targetString: Visa vinavyowezekana vitawasilishwa kama "Vinavyochunguzwa" (kuchunguza).

sourceString: “Not a case” will be presented as “Excluded”.
targetString: Sio kisa vitawasilishwa kuwa "Havijajumuishwa".

sourceString: Online data has been established within the initial few weeks in the COVID-19 Observatory (Figure 5), indicating the overall number of patients and rate per 10,000 patients of cases confirmed or under investigation, as well as where the virus is excluded.
targetString: Data ya mtandaoni imepatikana ndani ya wiki chache za awali katika Uangalizi wa COVID-19 (Picha ya 5), ikionyesha idadi ya jumla ya wagonjwa na kiwango kwa wagonjwa 10,000 wenye visa vilivyothibitishwa au vinavyofanyiwa uchunguzi, pamoja na pale virusi havijajumuishwa.

sourceString: We have the option to move to twice weekly surveillance reports with a scope to change this to daily reporting.
targetString: Tuna chaguo la kuhamisha hii hadi ripoti mara mbili za kila wiki la ufuatiliaji kwa lengo la kubadilisha hii kuwa ripoti ya kila siku.

sourceString: We will continue virology sampling from our sentinel practices, rather than discontinuing as seasonal influenza declines.
targetString: Tutaendelea kuchukua sampuli ya vairolojia kutoka katika matendo yetu ya uangalizi, kuliko kukomesha kuendelea homa ya mafua ya kimsimu ikipungua.

sourceString: Additionally, we will recruit more surveillance practices.
targetString: Vilevile, tutaweka matendo zaidi ya uchunguzi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC virology practices will aim to undertake 200-300 nasopharyngeal swabs per week across the RCGP RSC sentinel network, collecting specimens across all age bands.
targetString: Matendo ya vairolojia ya RCGP RSC yatalenga kuendesha shughuli ya kuchukua sampuli 200-300 za puani kila wiki katika mtandao mzima wa timu ya angalizi ya RCGP RSC, kukusanya sampuli katika fungo za umri wote.

sourceString: In addition to the inclusion criteria for influenza virology surveillance (ILI, acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis), participating practices will take nasopharyngeal swab samples from any people showing acute symptoms of LRTI if the onset of symptoms is within 7 days.
targetString: Pamoja na kujumuishwa kwa utaratibu kwa ujumuishaji wa uchunguzi wa vairolojia ya homa ya mafua (ILI, acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis), huduma zinazoshiriki zitachukua sampuli za puani kutoka kwa watu wowote wanaoonyesha dalili mbaya za LRTI ikiwa mwanzo wa dalili ni ndani ya siku 7.

sourceString: RCGP RSC research officers and practice liaison staff will manage practices to achieve a total national sample of 200-300 swabs per week.
targetString: Maafisa wa utafiti wa RCGP RSC na wafanyakazi washirikishi wa huduma watadhibiti huduma ili kufikia kuchukua jumla ya sampuli 200-300 kila wiki kitaifa.

sourceString: This could be increased if PHE modelers require more samples.
targetString: Hii inaweza kuongezwa ikiwa waundaji wa PHE watahitaji sampuli zaidi.

sourceString: Samples from each practice would be spread across the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years and older
targetString: Sampuli kutoka kila huduma zitasambazwa kwenye vikundi vifuatavyo vya umri: < miaka 5, miaka 5-17, miaka 18-64 na miaka 65 au zaidi

sourceString: Samples (swabs or serum) collected will be sent via prepaid envelopes addressed to the appropriate PHE laboratory for analysis.
targetString: Sampuli (swabu au serami) zilizokusanywa zitatumwa kupitia bahasha zinazolipiwa awali zinazotumwa katika mahabara yafaayo ya PHE ili kufanyiwa uchanganuzi.

sourceString: All samples collected will be tested for the presence of influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Sampuli zote zilizokusanywa zitapimwa kwa uwepo wa homa ya mafua na COVID-19.

sourceString: Additionally, PHE will retrospectively test any influenza virology samples collected between early and mid-February 2020 for COVID-19.
targetString: Isitoshe, PHE itafanya vipimo vya sampuli zozote zilizokusanywa awali za vairolojia ya homa ya mafua zilizokusanya kati ya mapema na katikati ya mwezi Februari 2020 kwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Practices will still follow the PHE protocol for COVID-19 with respect to people at risk of infection who should be signposted down the containment pathway, rather than physically attend their practice.
targetString: Wahudumu bado watafuta utaratibu wa PHE wa COVID-19 kuhusiana na watu walio hatarini kupata maambukizi wanaopaswa kuelekezwa katika njia ya udhibiti, badala ya kuhudhuria huduma yao moja kwa moja.

sourceString: Direct testing of those who attend surgery remains permitted, but we have also rolled out self-swabbing at home.
targetString: Kupimwa moja kwa moja kwa wale wanaoendea huduma ya upasuaji kumeruhusiwa lakini pia tumeanzisha vipimo vya sampuli nyumbani.

sourceString: Summary of processes are detailed in Multimedia Appendix 3.
targetString: Muhtasari wa michakato umeelewa kwenye kiambatisho cha 3 cha Midianuwai.

sourceString: Everyone with an ILI or a respiratory illness who contacts a GP (eg, phones for an appointment) should be asked specifically about recent travel to China and other countries flagged in current PHE advice, or if they have had contact with other people with COVID-19.
targetString: Kila mtu aliye na ILI au ugonjwa wa pumu anayewasiliana na GP(kwa mfano anapiga simu kuweka miadi) anapaswa kuulizwa hasa kuhusu safari ya hivi majuzi nchini China na nchi nyingine iliyowekwa tahadahri katika PHE ya sasa, au ikiwa wamegusana na watu walio na COVID-19.

sourceString: If these screening enquiries are positive, the patient would be advised to not come to the practice but instead to follow the PHE flow sheet.
targetString: Katika watu waliochunguzwa watapatikana na ugonjwa, watashauriwa kutokuja kwenye huduma badala yake wafuate laha ya PHE.

sourceString: This can be by a reception or clinician staff, depending on individual practice protocol.
targetString: Hii inaweza kufanywa na mpokezi au mfanyakazi wa kimatibabu, kwa kutegemea utaratibu wa huduma binafsi.

sourceString: These calls should be coded into the GP CMR system and can be reported as part of the RCGP RSC weekly return.
targetString: Simu hizi zinaweza kusimbwa kwenye mfumo wa GP CMR na zinaweza kuripotiwa kama sehemu ya rejesho la kila wiki la RCGP RSC.

sourceString: We have developed training material to support this coding (Multimedia Appendix 4).
targetString: Tumeunda nyenzo za mafunzo ili kusaidia usimbaji huu (Kiambatisho cha 4 cha Midianuwai).

sourceString: These include prompt cards for:
targetString: Hizi ni pamoja na kadi ndogo za:

sourceString: Practice reception or triage staff: for coding of any patients calling the practice with symptoms of acute respiratory infection with a history of travel to important areas based on PHE advice
targetString: Wafanyakazi wapokezi katika huduma: kwa ajili ya usimbaji wa wagonjwa wowote wanaokuja kwenye huduma na dalili za maambukizi mabaya ya pumu walio na historia ya kusafiri katika maeneo muhimu kulingana na ushauri wa PHE

sourceString: Administrative staff or clinicians who code: to encourage consistent coding of results for any suspected cases, including coding of negative results for exclusion
targetString: Wafanyakazi wasimamizi au matibabu wanaosimba: ili kuhimiza kusimbwa kwa matokeo kwa kisa chochote kinachoshukiwa, ikiwa ni pamoja na kusimba matokeo hasi ya kutojumuisha

sourceString: Practices participating in virology surveillance will opportunistically collect blood samples from patients coming into the practice for a routine blood test.
targetString: Huduma zinazoshiriki katika uchunguzi wa kivairolojia zitakusanya sampuli za damu kutoka kwa wagonjwa wanaokuja katika huduma kwa ajili ya vipimo vya kawaida vya damu.

sourceString: Patients who attend their practice for a routine blood test will be asked to provide an additional sample for serology.
targetString: Wagonjwa wanaohudhuria huduma zao kwa vipimo vya kawaida vya damu wataulizwa kutoa sampuli ya ziadi kwa ajili ya serolojia.

sourceString: We have conducted initial searches within the RCGP RSC database to look at the number of full blood count (FBC) results and overall rates in adults and children (Figures 6-​-9).9).
targetString: Tumefanya utafutaji wa awali ndani ya hifadhidata ya RCGP RSC ili kuangalia idadi ya matokeo ya idadi ya damu kamili (FBC) na viwango vya jumla kwa watu wazima na watoto (Picha ya 6--9).9).

sourceString: An FBC is one of the most common tests performed, and we hope this will give an approximate indication of overall numbers of blood tests performed.
targetString: Vipimo vya FBC ni mojawapo ya vipimo vya kawaida vinavyofanywa na tunatumai kwamba hii itatupa makadirio ya ishara ya jumla ya idadi ya vipimo vya damu vinavyofanywa.

sourceString: The sampling rate, per 100,000 patients was highest for children 15-17 years of age and 60 year or older in adults, with the lowest rates in children 0-4 years of age and 18-29 years of age in adults (Figures 6-​-99).
targetString: Viwango vya sampuli, wagonjwa 100,000 vilikuwa juu zaidi kwa watoto wenye umri wa miaka 15-17 na miaka 60 au zaidi kwa watu wazima, kwa viwango vya chini zaidi kwa watoto wa umri wa miaka 0-4 na miaka 18-29 kwa watu wazima (Picha 6--99).

sourceString: We will provide 1000 serology baseline samples across all ages that reflect the varying rates of attendance by age.
targetString: Tutatoa sampuli 1000 msingi za serolojia kutoka kwa watu wa umri wote zinazoakisi viwango tofuati vya watu kuja kulingana na umri.

sourceString: Additionally, we will test if we can obtain these all from virology practices to enhance the yield.
targetString: Vilevile, tunajaribu ikiwa tunaweza kupata haya yote kutoka kwenye huduma za kivairolojia ili kuboresha matokeo.

sourceString: A good geographical spread is important, so PHE can advise on areas where serology will most usefully be collected.
targetString: Maenezi mazuri kijiografia ni muhimu, ili PHE iweze kushauri kuhusu maeneo ambapo serolojia itakusanywa kwa umuhimu zaidi.

sourceString: This will be followed by 800 samples monthly.
targetString: Hii itafuatwa na sampuli 800 kila mwezi.

sourceString: The sample will be stratified with 200 specimens for prepandemic survey (100 for monthly) in the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years or older.
targetString: Sampuli hiyo itapangwa kwa chembe 200 kwa uchunguzi wa kabla ya janga (100 kwa kila mwezi) katika vikundi vifuatavyo vya umri: < miaka 5, miaka 5-17, miaka 18-64 na miaka 65 au zaidi.

sourceString: The younger patients, in many practices younger than 14 years, and in nearly all for children younger than 8 years will require pediatric serology surveillance.
targetString: Wangonjwa wa umri mdogo, katika huduma nyingi walio chini ya miaka 14 na takriban watoto wote walio chini ya miaka 8 watahitaji uchunguzi wa serolojia wa matibabu ta watoto.

sourceString: We will develop a new request form for practices to capture recent travel and exposure to COVID-19.
targetString: Tutaunda fomu mpya ya maombi ili huduma ziweze kunasa usafiri wa hivi majuzi na kuwepo hatarini kupata COVID-19.

sourceString: We will pilot a scheme for collecting convalescent serology from people with confirmed cases and who have had an acute virology sample at the time of their infection.
targetString: Tutafanya jaribio la mpango wa kukusanya serolojia ya watu wanaopona kutokana na via vilivyothibitishwa na ambao wamechukuliwa sampuli ya viarolojia wakati wa kuambukizwa kwao.

sourceString: This is to identify a carrier state in patients who have recovered from the virus but may continue shedding the virus.
targetString: Hii itasaidia kutambua hali za ubebaji kwa wagonjwa ambao wamepona kutokana na virusi lakini huenda bado wanatoa virusi.

sourceString: If there are a small number of cases, this may assist in developing a test kit for patients to take to their own GP and explore its acceptability to patients.
targetString: Ikiwa kuna idadi ndogo ya visa, hii inaweza kusaidia katika kuunda kifurushi cha kupima kwa wagonjwa kupeleka katika GP zao binafsi na kuchunguza kukubalika kwake kwa wagonjwa.

sourceString: If there are a large number of COVID-19 cases nationally, convalescent samples could be collected from RCGP RSC practices where there are confirmed cases, with the ability to link to the full medical record.
targetString: Iwapo kuna idadi kubwa sana ya visa vya COVID-19 kitaifa, sampuli za watu waliopona zinaweza kukusanywa kutoka katika huduma za RCGP RSC ambapo kuna visa vilivyothibitishwa, kukiwa na uwezo wa kuunganisha rekodi nzima ya kimatibabu.

sourceString: This process may include checking pseudonymized NHS numbers for positive individuals at RCGP RSC practices, checking current PHE guidance regarding considerations of infectiousness for confirmed cases, and offering the patient an appointment following the previously mentioned process.
targetString: Mchakato huu unaweza kujumuisha kuangalia nambari za NHS zisizotambulishwa kwa watu walio na ugonjwa katika huduma za RCGP RSC, kuangalia mwongozo wa sasa wa PHE kuhusiana na kuzingatiwa kwa uwezo wa kuambukizana wa visa vithibitishwa na kumwekea mgonjwa miadi kufuatia mchakato uliotajwa awali.

sourceString: This needs to be carefully coordinated nationally across the network and may require PHE to ensure individuals are not contacted by multiple agencies.
targetString: Hii inahitaji kuratibiwa kwa makini kitaifa katika mitandao mbalimbali na inaweza kuhitaji PHE kuhakikisha kwamba watu hawajapokea mawasiliano kutoka kwa mashirika mengi.

sourceString: RCGP RSC could provide a useful structure to channel the initial contact once PHE has made a request.
targetString: RCGP RSC inaweza kutoka muundo muhimu wa kutuma mwasiliani wa awali pindi tu PHE ikishatuma ombi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of a LRTI.
targetString: Huduma za RCGP RSC zinazoshiriki katika uchunguzi wa kila mwaka wa vairolojia ya homa ya mafua zimeanza kuchukua sampuli kutoka kwa wagonjwa wanaoonyesha dalili za LRTI.

sourceString: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Sampuli zote zilizopokewa zinapimwa kwa ajili ya homa ya mafua na COVID-19.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC will explore ways to collect convalescent samples from any patients tested positive for COVID-19 through the extension of the virological surveillance.
targetString: RCGP RSC itachunguza njia za kukusanya sampuli kutoka kwa mtu anayepona kutoka kwa wagonjwa wowote waliopatikana na COVID-19 kupitia kuendelezwa kwa ufuatiliaji wa kivairolojia.

sourceString: From the start, we will be carefully curating data to ensure that it can be used for future studies.
targetString: Kuanzia mwanzo, tutakuwa makini kupanga na kujumuisha data ili kuhakikisha kwamba inaweza kutumika katika tafiti za siku zijazo.

sourceString: Our clinical data will be linked to virology.
targetString: Data yetu ya kimatibabu itaunganishwa na vairolojia.

sourceString: We will curate our data using the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable principles.
targetString: Tutapanga na jumuisha data yetu kwa kutumia misingi ya Kupatikana, Kufikiwa, Kuhamishwa na Kutumika tena.

sourceString: To facilitate this our data set is listed with Health Data Research UK and the European Health Data Evidence Network.
targetString: Ili kuwezesha hili, seti ya data yetu imeorodheshwa na Health Data Research UK na European Health Data Evidence Network.

sourceString: The statistical methodology is in support of a policy approach to widespread disease outbreak, where so-called nonpharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used to respond to an emerging pandemic to produce disease suppression.
targetString: Mbinu ya kitakwimu inaunga mkono mwelekeo wa kisera kuhusu mkurupuko wa ugonjwa katika maeneo mengi, ambapo mikakati inayofahamika kuwa isiyokuwa ya kifamasia (NPI) inatumika ili kushughulikia janga kubwa la dharura kwa lengo la kudidimiza ugonjwa.

sourceString: This policy aims to reduce contact rates in the population and thereby reduce transmission of the virus.
targetString: Sera hii inalenga kupunguza viwango vya mgusano miongoni mwa watu na hivyo kupunguza usambazaji wa virusi.

sourceString: To implement this the UK government has recently articulated the desire to implement population self-isolation measures.
targetString: Ili kutekeleza haya, serikali ya Uingereza hivi majuzi imeeleza nia ya kutekeleza hatua za kuwatenga watu kibinfasi.

sourceString: By targeting the reproduction number (R) (the average number of secondary cases each case generates) and aiming to reduce the R to below 1, the policy seeks to reduce case numbers to low levels or (as seen in previous outbreaks with severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) to eliminate human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Kwa kulenga idadi ya uzalishaji (R) (idadi ya wastani ya visa vya pili vinavyotokana na kila kesi) na kulenga kupunguza R hadi chini ya 1, sera hii inalenga kupunguza idadi ya visa hadi viwango vya chini au (ilivyokuwa katika mikurupuko ya awali ya SARS na Ebola) ili kuondoa usambazaji kutoka kwa binadamu hadi kwa binadamu.

sourceString: As the experience from the 2009 H1N1 pandemic has shown, NPIs can be a crucial component of pandemic mitigation.
targetString: Ilivyokuwa katika janga kubwa la H1N1 la 2009, NPI inaweza kuwa sehemu muhiu ya kukabiliana na janga kubwa.

sourceString: Key to the focus of our study will be the estimation of peak cases in the population and continual monitoring by data collection and modelling the potential growth and emergence of subsequent peaks in new cases as social distancing measures are relaxed.
targetString: Kipengee muhimu katika utafiti wetu kitakuwa ni kukadiria visa vya upeo miongoni mwa watu na kuendelea kufuatilia ukusanyaji wa data na kuunda uwezekano wa kukua na kuibuka kwa upeo wa baadaye katika visa vipya huku hatua za kujiweka mbali ya jamii ikilegezwa kamba.

sourceString: There has already been publication of important disease epidemiological measures concerning the outbreak of COVID-19 in mainland China.
targetString: Tayari kuna chapisho la hatua muhimu za kiepidemiolojia ya ugonjwa kuhusiana na janga la COVID-19 katika China bara.

sourceString: A further fundamental measure in pandemic dynamics is the length of time from infection to when a person is infectious to others and the mean duration of infectiousness.
targetString: Kipimo kingine cha kimsingi katika masuala ya janga kubwa ni kiwango cha muda kuanzia wakati wa kuambukizwa hadi wakati mtu anaweza kuwaambukiza wengine na kipindi cha wastani cha uwezo wa kuambukizana.

sourceString: These factors, if estimated accurately, will give good predictions for the likely length of the pandemic, the final number of infected cases.
targetString: Vigezo hivi, vikikadiriwa kwa usahihi, vitatoa utabiri sahihi wa muda unaowezekana wa janga hili kubwa, idadi ya mwisho ya visa vya maambukizi.

sourceString: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to (possibly spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic models.
targetString: Tunanuia kutumia miundo isiyofuata utaratibu maalum ya uchanganuzi ya Bayesian inference (ABC) hadi (uwezekano wa mfanano kidogo) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR).

sourceString: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many fields including disease transmission modelling.
targetString: Mbinu kama hizi zina uwezekano wa juu wa kuwekwa sambamba na zimetumika kwa ufanisi katika nyanja nyingi ikiwa ni pamoja na uwekaji muundo wa usambazaji wa ugonjwa.

sourceString: They are particularly suited to situations where likelihood functions are absent and where more traditional approaches such as Markov chain Monte Carlo are impractical.
targetString: Zinatumika hasa katika hali ambapo vipengele vya uwezekano havipo na ambapo mielekeo ya kijadi zaidi kama vile Markov chain Monte Carlo haiwezi kutekelezwa.

sourceString: Such an approach has been demonstrated to work effectively on the ASPREN surveillance data, a network of sentinel GPs and nurse practitioners who report deidentified information on ILIs and other conditions, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observation process itself has been successfully addressed.
targetString: Mwelekeo kama huo umeonyeshwa kufanya kazi vyema katika uchunguzi wa data ya ASPREN, mtandao wa waangalizi wa GP na wahudumu wa uguzi wanaoripoti maelezo ambayo hayajatambuliwa kuhusu ILI na hali nyingine, ambapo masuala kama vile kukosekana kwa data na hitaji la kuunda mchakato mwenyewe wa uangalizi limefanikiwa kushughulikiwa.

sourceString: Furthermore, peaks in new cases have been estimated by distributional methods.
targetString: Isitoshe, upeo katika visa vipya umekadiriwa kupitia mbinu za kiusambazaji.

sourceString: Estimates of the parameters of the SEIR model are tractable on large data sets because of parallelizability, and these methods have been implemented in several R libraries; we intend to use the libraries ABSEIR (deposited on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) to estimate epidemic measures on a weekly basis.
targetString: Makadirio ya vipashio vya muundo wa SEIR yanaweza kufuatiliwa katika seti kubwa ya data kwa sababu uwezekano wa kuwekwa sambamba na mbinu hizi zimetekelezwa katika maktaba kadhaa ya R; tunanuia kutumia maktaba ya ABSEIR (iliyo kwenye GitHub:https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) na abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) ili kukadiria hatua za janga kwa msingi wa kila wiki.

sourceString: Since we are fitting an SIR-epidemic model in the ABC routine, we anticipate that our results will be robust against weekly case data containing relatively small counts.
targetString: Kwa vile tunaweka muundo wa janga wa SIR katika utarbitbu wa ABC, tunatarajia kwamba matokeo yetu yatakuwa makubwa yakilinganishwa na data ya kila wiki iliyo na idadi ndogo.

sourceString: For example, see for the ABC methodology applied to the Tristan da Cunha common cold data from 1967, where counts of I (number of infectious cases) and R (number of recovered cases) are in the tens at most.
targetString: Kwa mfano, tazama mbinu ya ABC iliyotumika katika Tristan da Cunha data ya homa ya kawaida mwaka wa 1967, ambapo hesabu ya I (idadi ya visa vya maambukizi) na R (idadi ya watu waliopona) ilikuwa kumi na kitu kwa wingi.

sourceString: Finally, in addition to the above methodology we will employ the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery) to estimate the case fatality ratio.
targetString: Hatimaye, pamoja na mbinu iliyo hapa juu, tutatumia mbinu ya Kaplan-Meier yenye matokeo mawili (vifo na uponaji) ili kukadiria viwango vya visa kusababisha vifo.

sourceString: This approach is independent of the ABC methodology and will allow comparisons between estimates from the two modelling approaches to judge robustness of results.
targetString: Mwelekeo huu hautegemei mbinu ya ABC na utaruhusu ulinganisho baina ya makadirio kutoka katika mielekeo hii mwili ya muundo ili kuamua upana wa matokeo.

sourceString: RCGP RSC's surveillance with PHE is defined as Health Protection under Regulation 3 of The Health Service (Control of Patient Information) Regulations 2002.
targetString: Uchunguzi wa RCGP RSC na PHE unafafanuliwa kuwa Ulinzi wa Afya chini ya Kanuni ya 3 ya Kanuni za Huduma ya Afya (Udhibiti wa Maelezo ya Mgonjwa) za 2002.

sourceString: This has been confirmed by PHE's Caldicott Guardian's Office.
targetString: Hili limethibitishwa na Ofisi ya PHE ya Caldicott Guardian.

sourceString: We do not see any increased risk to practices or practitioners taking part in this surveillance.
targetString: Hatuoni ongezeko la hatari kwa huduma au wahudumu wanaoshiriki katika uchunguzi huu.

sourceString: Infection prevention and control advice will follow extant national guidance.
targetString: Ushauri wa uzuiaji na udhibiti wa maambukizi utafuata mwongozo uliopo wa kitaifa.

sourceString: Any cases identified will be managed according to the PHE/NHS guidance in force at the time, including advice for identified contacts.
targetString: Visa vyovyote vitakavyotambuliwa vitadhibitiwa kulingana na mwongozo wa PHE/NHS unaotekelezwa kwa wakati huo ikiwa ni pamoja na ushauri kwa watu waliogusana waliotambuliwa.

sourceString: However, our training will include reminders about safe handling of specimens and revision of infection control measures anticipated to be high in our practices.
targetString: Hata hivyo, mafunzo yetu yatajumuisha vikumbusho kuhusu kushughulikia sampuli kwa njia salama na kudurusiwa kwa udhibiti wa maambukizi yanaytrajiwa kuwa ya juu katika huduma zetu.

sourceString: It is a key part of Regulation 12 about safe care and treatment, periodically inspected by the Care Quality Commission.
targetString: Ni sehemu muhimu ya Kanuni ya 12 kuhusu tiba salama na matibabu, ikikaguliwa muda baada ya muda na Tume ya Ubora wa Tiba.

sourceString: Travel History and Clinical Descriptors of the COVID-19 Infections
targetString: Historia ya Usafiri na Maelezo ya Kimatibabu ya maambukizi ya COVID-19

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices have been advised on the clinical coding that has been made available for COVID-19 across all CMR systems.
targetString: Huduma za RCGP RSC zimeshauriwa kuhusu usimbaji wa kimatibabu ambao unapatikana kwa ajili ya COVID-19 katika mifumo yote ya CMR.

sourceString: This includes information on coding of clinical descriptors (Table 4) and any recent travel history.
targetString: Hii ni pamoja na maelezo kuhusu usimbaji wa maelezo ya kimatibabu (Jedwali la 4) na historia yoyote ya usafiri hivi majuzi.

sourceString: Establishment of Extended Virology Sampling
targetString: Kuunda Sampuli Iliyoendelezwa ya Vairolojia

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of LRTI.
targetString: Huduma za RCGP RSC zinazoshiriki katika uchunguzi wa kila mwaka wa vairolojia ya homa ya mafua zimeanza kuchukua sampuli za wagonjwa wanaoonyesha dalili za LRTI.

sourceString: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Sampuli zote zilizopokewa zinapimwa kwa ajili ya homa ya mafua na COVID-19.

sourceString: This has led to initial early identification of background spread in low-risk patients.
targetString: Hii imesababisha utambuzi wa mapema wa usuli miongoni wa wagonjwa wa hatari ya chini.

sourceString: As of March 7, 2020, the surveillance system has detected 2 cases of COVID-19 in low-risk patients with no history of travel through extended virological sampling.
